item.title: 051 - Sport Puck
item.author: Michael Edwards and David Lyons
item.description: It's still a speedrun even if you use exploits. In fact that's kind of the point. Blackberry wants to win through legislation. Comcast and Twitter; still terrible after all these months. And as Google sunsets the Glass Explorer program, Microsoft debuts HoloLens.
item.content:encoded:
It's still a speedrun even if you use exploits. In fact that's kind of the point. Blackberry wants to win through legislation. Comcast and Twitter; still terrible after all these months. And as Google sunsets the Glass Explorer program, Microsoft debuts HoloLens.

Show Notes

  • Podcast Awards
  • @rothgar nominate Flipping Tables for best gaming podcast
  • Speedrunner Sets New World Record for Fastest Time in Super Mario World
  • BlackBerry CEO Wants Legislators To Make Developing BlackBerry Apps Mandatory
  • Exclusive: politicians are supporting Comcast's TWC merger with letters ghostwritten by Comcast
  • Tweetbot for Mac falls victim to token limit, gets pulled from App Store
  • PaperLike: 13.3″ E Ink Monitor
  • New amazing metal is so hydrophobic it makes water bounce like magic
  • Google Is Said To Be Preparing Its Own Mobile Wireless Service
  • Today Is The Last Day To Buy Google Glass
  • Ok Glass, Write a Review
  • Opportunity, Google Glass, and Cadavers
  • Hands-on: Microsoft’s HoloLens is flat-out magical

View show notes on Sunrise Robot.

Discuss this episode:
Twitter | Facebook | Google+

Flipping Tables is hosted by Michael Edwards and David Lyons. Check out other Sunrise Robot shows at sunriserobot.net.

item.title: 050 - Maximum Computer Smartness
item.author: Michael Edwards and David Lyons
item.description: Smash Bros. is still fun after all these years. Mike and Lyons are going to track their internet usage. And the #SOTU shall be tweeted, youtubed, instagramed, and other Web 2.0 buzz words. Will policy actually improve though? That remains to be seen.
item.content:encoded:
Smash Bros. is still fun after all these years. Mike and Lyons are going to track their internet usage. And the #SOTU shall be tweeted, youtubed, instagramed, and other Web 2.0 buzz words. Will policy actually improve though? That remains to be seen.

Show Notes

  • Smash Bros Wii U - CPU struggles with tiny platforms
  • sookie-cake-flip.gif
  • Human Chess in Russia
  • Web Timer
  • State of the Union speech on Medium
  • The Whitehouse on Youtube
  • Obama and Cameron’s ‘solutions’ for cybersecurity will make the internet worse
  • Obama talks cybersecurity, but Federal IT system breaches increasing
  • Rumor: 12-inch Retina MacBook/Air updates coming soon without fan or mechanical trackpad button
  • EyeFi

item.title: 049 - Everything I Know About Him Is That He Is A Miserable Failure
item.author: Michael Edwards and David Lyons
item.description: CES 2015 is over and we're not going to recap it because we're better than that, but we will talk about it. Just the interesting parts though. Promise. Also, RealPlayer thinks they're a startup now?
item.content:encoded:
CES 2015 is over and we're not going to recap it because we're better than that, but we will talk about it. Just the interesting parts though. Promise. Also, RealPlayer thinks they're a startup now?

Show Notes

  • RealPlayer BS marketing quote
  • UK Prime Minister Wants Backdoors into Messaging Apps or He'll Ban Them
  • Chrome Remote Desktop for iOS
  • LG G Flex 2
  • Yota Devices Talks A Future Of E-Ink Devices Beyond The YotaPhone At CES 2015
  • Here's Sharp's 85-inch 8K TV with glasses-free 3D
  • Kelvin - Serving wine at the correct temperature makes a big difference
  • Wireless Charging Ready to Cut Power Cords in Public Places
  • IO Hawk
  • Sony 4K Action Cam
  • Here's Sharp's 85-inch 8K TV with glasses-free 3D

item.title: 048 - Buy Other Rectangles
item.author: Michael Edwards and David Lyons
item.description: Marriott proves they hate you by blocking your wifi devices. Mike and Lyons still haven't found the wearables they're looking for. And fan-made games are sometimes better than the originals; particularly when they play themselves!
item.content:encoded:
Marriott proves they hate you by blocking your wifi devices. Mike and Lyons still haven't found the wearables they're looking for. And fan-made games are sometimes better than the originals; particularly when they play themselves!

Show Notes

  • Google and Microsoft Oppose Hotels’ Effort to Block Personal Wi-Fi
  • I Still Haven't Found The Wearable I'm Looking For
  • Mario 64 HD Remake
  • Megaman: Revenge of the Fallen
  • Mother 4
  • Megaman Eternal
  • Megaman 2.5D
  • Castlevania II: Simon’s Quest REDACTION
  • Flip All The Pronouns
  • Super Mario World Music Video Special Level
  • Mother 3 Fan Translation
  • Justin Garrison’s 2014 Technology Predictions
  • Justin Garrison’s 2015 Technology Predictions

item.title: 047 - Winning Is More Important Than Our Friendship
item.author: Michael Edwards and David Lyons
item.description: Get any good games for Christmas? Too bad you didn't get to play them thanks to DDoS attacks against the PSN and Xbox Live. At least you had the option to watch The Interview on Youtube. Win?
item.content:encoded:
Get any good games for Christmas? Too bad you didn't get to play them thanks to DDoS attacks against the PSN and Xbox Live. At least you had the option to watch The Interview on Youtube. Win?

Show Notes

  • NES30
  • NES30 on Amazon
  • Sony Releases ‘The Interview’ Online
  • It's OK if you don't watch The Interview on Christmas, or ever
  • Seth Rogen’s response to The Verge
  • Xbox Live And PlayStation Network Knocked Offline For Much Of Christmas

item.title: 046 - I Don’t Like The Level of Maturity Required
item.author: Michael Edwards and David Lyons
item.description: Lyons spends a week with Mike's Pebble smartwatch. And the Sony hack. 300TB of data stolen, a (likely terrible) movie canceled, thousands of employees personal information exposed. It's bad, baby. Real bad.
item.content:encoded:
Lyons spends a week with Mike's Pebble smartwatch. And the Sony hack. 300TB of data stolen, a (likely terrible) movie canceled, thousands of employees personal information exposed. It's bad, baby. Real bad.

Show Notes

  • pebble
  • How to Unfollow All Followers on Twitter in 3 Seconds 5/22/14
  • A Look Through The Sony Pictures Data Hack: This Is As Bad As It Gets
  • Mitt Romney on twitter
  • Hacked corporations don’t deserve our sympathy
  • Sony Might Release 'The Interview' For Free Online
  • Leaked ‘the Interview’ Clip Shows Kim Jong-un Death Scene (Video)
  • A Tribute To Stephen Colbert, A Self-Proclaimed 'Junkie For Exhaustion'

item.title: 045 - Sonic On Gamegear Is Not A Good Look
item.author: Michael Edwards and David Lyons
item.description: Lyons rights an ancient wrong by finally playing GoldenEye. Teens play Megaman and are surprisingly optimistic about how bad they are. Gangnam Style actually breaks Youtube. And Pebble finds a way to stay in the game a little longer.
item.content:encoded:
Lyons rights an ancient wrong by finally playing GoldenEye. Teens play Megaman and are surprisingly optimistic about how bad they are. Gangnam Style actually breaks Youtube. And Pebble finds a way to stay in the game a little longer.

Show Notes

  • The Tetris God
  • Mega Man (NES) (Teens React: Retro Gaming)
  • How to Electronic Mail
  • Nuclear steam stacks collapsing GIF
  • Gangnam Style view counter can’t fit in a 32-bit integer
  • Google Drops Support for Security Questions
  • Lights, Smartwatch, Action: Android Wear notifications come to Pebble (Release Notes)

item.title: 044 - Balloons That Rain Down Wifi on Africa
item.author: Michael Edwards and David Lyons
item.description: Square Enix continues trolling the world by releasing the original FFVII on PS4 like it was a big deal, and the 3D version of FFIV on Steam as if that was the version we wanted. Suikoden proves some games can cast off RPG tropes. Wire is yet another revolutionary chat app. And Google fixes the CAPTCHA.
item.content:encoded:
Square Enix continues trolling the world by releasing the original FFVII on PS4 like it was a big deal, and the 3D version of FFIV on Steam as if that was the version we wanted. Suikoden proves some games can cast off RPG tropes. Wire is yet another revolutionary chat app. And Google fixes the CAPTCHA.

Show Notes

  • The Little Synthboy EP
  • Final Fantasy IV on Steam
  • The Internet Reacts to Final Fantasy VII on PS4
  • Final Fantasy VII “returns”
  • Last Year: A 5 vs 1 Multiplayer Survival Horror Game That's Basically Friday the 13th
  • Last Year - 5 vs 1 Multiplayer Survival Horror on KickStarter
  • 5 Suikoden Series Trivia - VGFacts Five Trivia Feat. brutalmoose
  • Ex-Skypers unveil Wire app, offering voice, messaging and more
  • Are you a robot? Introducing “No CAPTCHA reCAPTCHA”
  • The HowToGeek on Amazon brand diapers

item.title: 043 - I Just Assumed I Would Have Bread Forever
item.author: Michael Edwards and David Lyons
item.description: How do you deal with rape threats on the internet? Tell the perpetrator's mother! Twitter is spying on the apps you have installed because they can't stop being terrible. Apple breaks its own rules and sends unwanted push notifications. Flickr decides to sell your photos. And Google makes paying to remove ads an option.
item.content:encoded:
How do you deal with rape threats on the internet? Tell the perpetrator's mother! Twitter is spying on the apps you have installed because they can't stop being terrible. Apple breaks its own rules and sends unwanted push notifications. Flickr decides to sell your photos. And Google makes paying to remove ads an option.

Show Notes

  • Game reviewer received rape threats from boys, contacted their mothers
  • Twitter Is Going To Spy On You Via The Apps You Install, Here's How To Stop It
  • Apple bends its own rules by using push notification to promote the App Store's (RED) campaign
  • A Kickstarter Promises If You Bleed in the Game, You'll Bleed For Real
  • Game System - Perry Bible Fellowship comic
  • What’s Wrong with This Picture? Flickr Is about to Sell off Your Creative Commons Photos
  • Google Contributor: can I really pay to remove ads?

View show notes on Sunrise Robot.

item.title: 042 - Hit Me With Your Gunblade
item.author: Michael Edwards and David Lyons
item.description: How has Nintendo avoided shipping broken games? Maybe skipping DLC holds you to a higher standard. Uber's awfulness hopefully paves the way for competition. And Lyons geeks out of Final Fantasy VI.
item.content:encoded:
How has Nintendo avoided shipping broken games? Maybe skipping DLC holds you to a higher standard. Uber's awfulness hopefully paves the way for competition. And Lyons geeks out of Final Fantasy VI.

Show Notes

  • David comments about Fallout
  • Assassin’s Creed Unity Returns Faces To NPCs Who Have Lost Them
  • Smartphone encryption could lead to death of a child, government claims
  • Nintendo Is Not Planning On Releasing More Smash Bros. DLC
  • Super Smash Bros. Technical Play Special - Did You Know Gaming? Feat. Yungtown
  • The moment I learned just how far Uber will go to silence journalists and attack women
  • The guy who accused Sarah Lacy of “playing victim” over Uber forgot to disclose he’s “bros” with the company’s two most senior execs
  • Final Fantasy VI - Dancing Mad [Remastered]
  • I'm sorry we didn't have polygons left for you, Cid

View show notes on Sunrise Robot.
